haha similar experience here. Over the course of 3 or 4 years I've played in this order: Demon's Souls, Dark Souls 2, Dark Souls 1 (about 1/4 thru), Bloodborne (pre-dlc), Dark Souls 2 SotFS (100% Achievement), Bloodborne (post-dlc + 100% Achievement), Demon's Souls (100% Achievement), Dark Souls 1 (100% Achievement), Dark Souls 3 (pre-dlc), Dark Souls 1 (PC / Fun builds like Giant Dad and lvl4 twink), Dark Souls 3 (Post-DLC). Currently working on the 100% achievement for Dark Souls 3.
Yea co-oping can go a long way in mitigating some of the stress that comes with the solo experience of Dark Souls.

WRITING.TEXT: VERY GOOD

The ending of The Ringed City DLC is a metaphor for the player giving the game back to FromSoft so they can move on and make a new game. The player gives the Blood of the Dark Soul (the game / The Dark Souls franchise), to the Painting Woman (FromSoft / the developer), so she can paint a new world (make a new game).
The Painted World of Ariamis (from Dark Souls 1) was actually a demo / proof of concept for the original Dark Souls. Painted Worlds (Ariamis and Ariandel) are metaphors for video games. The painter (game developer) paints a world (makes a game) in which others (players) can enter and experience that which the painter created.
my life is complete now.

WRITING.TITLE: Tove Styrke - Say My Name [Pop / Electropop]

WRITING.TEXT: I definitely think the Asylum Demon in Dark Souls is the best intro boss for new players. It just breaks so many conventions that you normally see in video games.

WRITING.TITLE: Tove Styrke - Say My Name [Pop / Electropop]
